Detailed Description

Specific implementation of the ForceTorqueSensor class,.

The ForceTorqueSensor function getForcesAndTorques() gets the force and torque data from the Ati FT Server, whose name can be specified in the global confiuguration file. Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: End Effector Classes 
// Authors:   Vijayakrishna Basettihalli
// Start Date: Fri Jun 08 06:12:46 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: AtiFTSensor.t.cpp
// Example program for the class AtiFTSensor.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <conio.h>


// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "AtiFTSensor.hpp"

//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  AtiFTSensor atiFTSensor;
      
  if (atiFTSensor.d_objectStatus.isStatusError()) 
  {
    cout << atiFTSensor.d_objectStatus.getMessageText() << endl;
    return -1;
  }
  
  cout << "Menu: " << endl;
  cout << " \t[g] Get Forces And Torques" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[q] Quit" <<endl;
  char ch;
  double ft[6]; 
  while ((ch=getch()) != 'q') 
  {
    if (ch=='g')
      atiFTSensor.getForcesAndTorques(ft);
      cout << "Forces : " << ft[0] << "\t" << ft[1] << "\t" << ft[2] << endl;
      cout << "Torques : " << ft[3] << "\t" << ft[4] << "\t" << ft[5] << endl;
  }
  
  RoboticPlatform::exit();            
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AtiFTSensor ( const char * objectName )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the object name. If the section in the global configuration file specified by the object name has the class name "AtiFTSensor", then the settings of this section are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
objectName   Object name, identical with the section name in the global configuration file.

AtiFTSensor ( int numInConfig = 1 )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the number of the object in the global configuration file that specifies the class name "AtiFTSensor". The settings of this object in the global configuration are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
numInConfig   Number of the object in the global configuration file (only objects of the correct class type are counted), starting at "1".

AtiFTSensor ( const TypeInfo * parent ) [protected]
 

The constructor initializes class variables. This constructor is only called from a derived class.

~AtiFTSensor ( ) [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void localInit ( ) [protected, virtual]
 

This function is called from all constructors. It does the actual class initialization.

Reimplemented from ForceTorqueSensor.

void getForcesAndTorques ( double * ) [virtual]
 

gets the forces and torques from the AtiFTServer.

Returns:
An array with the 3-axes forces and the 3-axes toques.

void setSimulationModeOn ( )
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Sets simulation mode on and switches off hardware control.

void setSimulationModeOff ( )
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Sets simulation mode off and starts hardware control.

void readGlobalConfiguration ( Config * config )
 

Reimplemented from class PhysicalObject. Reads in entries for digital channels to control the ForceTorqueSensor, control values and name of I/O server to connect to.

void outputInfo ( ostream & stream = cout ) [virtual]
 

Outputs information about the object to an output stream. This class adds hardware specific information of the manipulator such as the IOBoardServerName, channels for arm power bit, etc.

Parameters:
stream   Stream to output the information to.

Returns the type info of the class.
